title: Run Commands
description: Run any custom commands with Nx.

commands.description: Commands to run in child process.

command.description: Command to run in child process.

forwardAllArgs.description: Whether arguments should be forwarded when interpolation is not present.

prefix.description: Prefix in front of every line out of the output

description.description: An optional description useful for inline documentation purposes. It is not used as part of the execution of the command.

command.description: Command to run in child process.

readyWhen.description: String to appear in `stdout` or `stderr` that indicates that the task is done. When running multiple commands, this option can only be used when `parallel` is set to `true`. If not specified, the task is done when all the child processes complete.

args.description: Extra arguments. You can pass them as follows: nx run project:target --args='--wait=100'. You can then use {args.wait} syntax to interpolate them in the workspace config file. See example [above](#chaining-commands-interpolating-args-and-setting-the-cwd)

envFile.description: You may specify a custom .env file path.

color.description: Use colors when showing output of command.

cwd.description: Current working directory of the commands. If it's not specified the commands will run in the workspace root, if a relative path is specified the commands will run in that path relative to the workspace root and if it's an absolute path the commands will run in that path.

env.description: Environment variables that will be made available to the commands. This property has priority over the `.env` files.
